## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

# Tarea

```{r}
x2 <- c(10,12,30,22,4)
# Funcion c es de "combinar"
print(x2)
x4 <- sum(x2)

edades <- c(43,41,21,11)
print("Edades:")
print(edades)
print(edades[2])
edad1 <- edades[1]
edad2 <- edades[2]
print("La suma de dos primeras edades:")
sum(edad1,edad2)
# mean es un promedio 
mean(edades)
nombre <- "Natalia"
print(nombre)
nombres <- c("Natalia","Juan","EricK","Sofia")
print(nombres[3])
print(nombres[c(1,3)])
my_data <- data.frame(nombres,edades)
my_data
print(my_data$edades)
print(my_data$edades[3])
print(my_data$edades[c(1,3)])
print(my_data[3,1])
x <- 1
y <- 2
iguales <- (x == y)
print(iguales)
hist(my_data$edades)
```
